title: vintage army font
content:
Really similar to Futura heavy / century gothic but M is more slanted. Any guesses ?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830003808im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2_5600.jpg)
author: al0212

comments.content:
Guess: this is probably more vintage than you were looking for. (/Y's not perfect either).  
Argel, Billy/TOSCA ZERO  
 [http://www.dafont.com/search.php?q=TOSCA&text=.%20ARMY%20](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830003808/http:/www.dafont.com/search.php?q=TOSCA&text=.%20ARMY%20 "http://www.dafont.com/search.php?q=TOSCA&text=.%20ARMY%20").

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830003808im_/http:/typophile.com/files/army1_4793.jpg)

I agree ARMY is similar to Futura Heavy & Century Gothic Bold. If you used Futura Heavy you could flip the W to get a more sloped M. If you standardize the capital height of Futura Heavy & Century Gothic Bold, you could Century Gothic Bold for A & Y, and a flipped W for M, plus Futura Heavy for the R.  
Don
Great suggestion Don !! Thank you so much : )
